snippet: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida said four more cases had been identified in the Wynwood neighborhood, the only place in the continental United States with active transmission....
abstract: Miami officials say four more people have been identified as likely to have acquired Zika virus from area mosquitoes, bringing number of locally-acquired cases to 21; Hillary Clinton, during campaign stop in city, calls on Congress to pass emergency funding to fight disease.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida said four more cases had been identified in the Wynwood neighborhood, the only place in the continental United States with active transmission.

headline.main: Zika Cases Rise in Miami, and Officials Try to Soothe Fears
headline.print_headline: Zika Cases Rise in Miami, but Remain Contained
